result.execSummary:
The defendant Curtis G Tillman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
No violations of the law that rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with CNF which rises to the level of probable cause for arrest for abuse or harassment.

Cooperate with agent.
Obtain Anger Management Counseling.

AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
Upon successful completion of probation, Court will allow for expungement.

Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
All Mandatory Court costs, fees, and surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) to be collected during the term of probation. Bail on deposit to apply. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Restitution is set at zero.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Curtis G Tillman

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Curtis G Tillman in court.  Attorney Colleen A Taylor in court for Curtis G Tillman.  Prosecuting attorney Jessica Bellows in court for the State of Wisconsin.    Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of Defendant.  

As to Count 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

Sentencing Proceeded. Statements made by the State, Defense counsel and the defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to 120 days in the House of Correction, with Huber release, credit for 4 days. IMPOSED and STAYED. The Court placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-No violations of the law that rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent.
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
-Obtain Anger Management Counseling.
-Provide 25 hours of community service.
-No contact with CNF which rises to the level of probable cause for arrest for abuse or harassment.
-Obtain GED
-All Mandatory Court costs, fees, and surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) to be collected during the term of probation. Bail on deposit to apply.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
-Restitution is set at zero 

Upon successful completion of probation, Court will allow for expungement.    mn

Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Curtis G Tillman in court.  Attorney Colleen A Taylor in court for Curtis G Tillman.  Attorney Jessica Bellows in court for State of Wisconsin.   Due to congested calendar, and with the permission of the Court, this matter is adjourned for plea and sentencing  in Br 45.  mn
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief, Filed.

Defendant Curtis G Tillman in court with attorney Travis Schwantes on behalf of Colleen A Taylor.  Kathryn Ginsberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Curtis G Tillman appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense requests a plea date.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Judge Jean Kies, Br 45, room G55 in CJF  Plea hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Email correspondence with parties. Case re-scheduled for a Scheduling Conference on 07/25/2022 at 08:30am, Br 34.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 6-28-2022

Defendant Curtis G Tillman in court, appear by video with attorney Colleen A Taylor, appear by video.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 34, Judge Yamahiro. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 34.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with CNF, MEB, TDJ
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Curtis G Tillman in court with attorney Colleen Cullen.  Defendant Curtis G Tillman in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Curtis G Tillman appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
